III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4148
Section Personal hygiene
Description
1

(1) An institution shall assure that each resident maintains or
receives personal care, hygiene, and grooming appropriate to the
resident's age, sex, race, cultural background, and health needs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/16, a youth was locked in a room and not allowed to leave.
The youth was denied use of the bathroom and urinated on
themselves. The youth was denied use of the shower after this.
Investigation The complainant was anonymous.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Youth A described sleeping in a different
area than the rest of the youth because the youth on her unit have
been threatening her and trying to jump her. Youth A reported
while in this separate sleep area she urinated on herself because
Staff 1 would not allow her to use the bathroom. Youth A stated
she was thirsty; took an empty can from something Staff 1 drank
earlier and was going to fill it with water when she went to the
bathroom. Youth A reported Staff 1 asked Staff 2, who was in the
hallway, to check and make sure things were safe so Youth A
could leave the room to use the bathroom. Youth A stated Staff 2
told Youth A to give the can to Staff 1 then she could come out of
the room and use the bathroom. Youth A reported she tucked the
can under her dress and ended up urinating herself because Staff
1 and Staff 2 would not let her out of the room. Youth A stated
she told Staff 1 and Staff 2 she needed to use the restroom, but
they [Staff 1 and Staff 2] said she first had to give them the tin
can.
Youth A described after urinating herself her dress was wet, and
she asked to take a shower. Youth A stated Staff 1 told her she
could not shower until the next day. Youth A reported she
believed it was about 9pm when the incident occurred. Youth A
stated Staff 1 provided Youth A with a change of clothes, water,
shampoo, and a towel and told Youth A she could clean up in the
bathroom. Youth A reported she was able to shower in the
morning.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Staff 1 described Youth A as being “very
frustrated” that night. Staff 1 reported Youth A was on a 1:1 plan
with staff to ensure Youth A’s safety. Staff 1 stated Youth A had
been antagonizing the youth, running into youths’ bedrooms and
ripping things off the wall, breaking items, flipping her peers off,
talking about her peers’ family members and being an instigator all
2

night with her [Youth A] behavior. Staff 1 described the other
youth on the unit had tried to assault Youth A. Staff 1 reported it
was decided by Director to have Youth A sleep in a separate
place from her peers to help calm the unit and keep Youth A safe.
Staff 1 reported she was Youth A’s 1:1 staff. Staff 1 stated she
drank an energy drink, and the can was still in the room. Staff 1
reported she could not recall if the can was empty or not. Staff 1
described Youth A being agitated, walking around the room and
taking the can and placing it under her dress. Staff 1 reported this
was about 10:30pm. Staff 1 stated Youth A asked to use the
bathroom but had used the bathroom about 30 to 40 minutes
earlier. Staff 1 described Staff 2 walking up to the door from the
hallway to check on her and Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A
urinated on herself at that time. Staff 1 stated she had been
texting with Supervisor about Youth A’s agitation and let
Supervisor know Youth A urinated on herself. During the
interview Staff 1 asked to look at her phone to provide the exact
time Youth A urinated on herself; the text thread documented
Youth A urinated on herself at 11:04. Staff 1 reported she did not
smell urine, but the front of Youth A’s dress was wet.
Staff 1 stated Youth A asked to take a shower but was told no
because her peers were asleep on the unit. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was given a clean change of clothes, towel, soap and
offered the restroom to clean up. Staff 1 stated it was decided not
to take Youth A to the unit to shower because it would have
woken up the other youth and Youth A’s peers were already upset
with Youth A so there was concern the unit would escalate. Staff
1 reported Youth A refused to change and clean up at first but
eventually did go to the bathroom to clean up. Staff 1 stated in the
morning Staff 3 took Youth A to shower.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Youth B describe Youth A as being,
“disrespectful, mean to us [youth], a bully,” and stated Youth A
destroyed Youth B’s bedroom. Youth B reported Youth A is
currently in a different part of the building. Youth B stated staff
redirect Youth A but “she doesn’t care, she just keep doing it.”
Youth B denied staff not allowing her or any other youth to use the
bathroom. Youth B stated youth must ask but stated she has
never been told no.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Staff 2 described stopping to check and
3

see how Youth A and Staff 1 were doing as he was aware they
were in a separate location from the other girls. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was escalated, pacing, tipping items over in the room,
and grabbed a can that was on a desk and put it in her pants.
Staff 2 stated he asked Youth A for the can several times, but she
refused to give the can to Staff 2 or Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth
A started yelling that she wanted to go to the bathroom. Staff 2
stated he told Youth A she could use the bathroom as soon as
she handed over the tin can. Staff 2 described Youth A yelling
about being separated from her peers and then shouted, “I peed
myself.” Staff 2 reported Youth A was wearing shorts and a flowy
shirt and could not recall if the clothes were wet. Staff 2 stated
there was a wet spot on the carpet. Staff 2 reported he was not
sure if there was liquid in the can Youth A took. Staff 2 stated
when Youth A took the can Youth A placed it in the waistband of
the shorts and the shirt covered the can. Staff 2 denied smelling
urine and stated he was not sure Youth A actually “peed on
herself, that it could have been liquid left in the can.”
Staff 2 reported Youth A asked to shower but it was after 11pm
and the girls on the unit were sleeping. Staff 2 stated he was
concerned if Youth A was taken to the unit to shower, she would
wake up the girls and the situation with the youth would start
again. Staff 2 described there were only four staff working, and
one of them [Staff 1] was Youth A’s 1:1. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was offered a change of clothes and soap to clean up in the
bathroom. Staff 2 stated Youth A refused to go to the bathroom
and was not sure if she ended up changing her clothes or not.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Supervisor reported he was watching the
camera in real time and offering coaching to Staff 1. Supervisor
stated there were four staff working that night, not enough staff to
take Youth A to the administrative building to shower. Supervisor
described putting a bag together for Youth A with extra clothes
prior to leaving for the day. Supervisor stated he packed two sets
of clothes in a bag: a dress, white sweatpants, pink hoody, and
two pairs of underwear. Supervisor reported Youth A showered
the next morning.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 25, 2025. Staff 3 described taking Youth A to shower
the morning after Youth A urinated on herself. Staff 3 reported
she could not recall the exact time Youth A was taken to shower
but thought it was around 8:30 or 9am. Staff 3 stated she did not
smell urine on Youth A and Youth A did not say anything to her
4

about the incident from the night before. Staff 3 reported she was
aware of what occurred from reading about the incident.
Video Reviewed
Video footage of 9/16/2025 of Youth A was reviewed on
9/22/2025. Youth A is seen walking around the room, grabbing a
can off a table, waving it around in her right hand, and standing in
front of the door that leads to the hallway where the bathroom is
located. Staff 1 is facing Youth A and appears to be talking (there
is no sound on the video). Staff 2 is seen through the window on
the other side of the door, in the hallway. The door opens and
Youth A stands in the doorway. Staff 1 and Staff 2 appear to be
talking with Youth A. Video shows Staff 1 providing clothes to
Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed orientation/new hire training on
6/21/2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was one record of verbal
warning related to issues with attendance. Staff 2
completed orientation/new hire training on 3/22/2024.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report regarding
Youth A for the incident on 9/16/2025. Incident report is
consistent with video review and staff interviews.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Policy. Policy 2.0
documents, “Treat all youth with dignity and respect.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and video review, Staff 1 and Staff 2 told Youth A she
could use the bathroom as soon as she gave them a tin can she
had hidden in the waistband of her shorts. After Youth A urinated
on herself, she was provided with the option to clean up in the
bathroom with soap, towel and clean change of clothes. Youth A
was allowed to shower in the morning.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
